":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"timelockRepaymentAccept","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"newOwner","type":"address"}],"name":"transferOwnership","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"string","name":"newBtcPubkey","type":"string"}],"name":"updateLenderBtcPubkey","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_loanDuration","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_timelockLoanReq","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_timelockBtcEscrow","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_timelockRepaymentAccept","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_timelockBtcCollateral","type":"uint256"}],"name":"updateParameters","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"loanId","type":"uint256"}],"name":"withdrawLoanOffer","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"loanId","type":"uint256"}],"name":"withdrawRepaymentAttempt","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"stateMutability":"payable","type":"receive"}],"devdoc":{"details":"A smart contract for handling collateralized loans where Bitcoin is used as collateral The contract integrates with EtherSwap.sol (from Boltz.exchange) for atomic swaps between Bitcoin and Ethereum These are not really swaps in the sense that the bitcoin collateral will remain in joint custody Such details about the bitcoin side of things are treated as external data here. e.g. the preimage hash of the borrower's preimage is used by lender to commit btc to collateral address, but this is only possible because the borrower has signed a pre-signed btc tx with the lender's public key. Such details are explained in the project documentation The borrower can reclaim the collateral only if the loan is repaid successfully. If the borrower defaults, the lender will get the collateral While HTLCs make atomicity possible, they cannot guarantee participation of both parties. Thus, if the lender does not accept loan repayment, then the borrower cannot reclaim the collateral. In this case, the borrower can recover their attempted repayment, and also slash the lender's bond. The loans are meant to be in rBTC for use in Rootstock (1:1 peg with BTC), so a price oracle is not required. There is no possibility of liquidation of LTV going over 100%. When used in other chains, an oracle will be needed for pricing (e.g. ETH 2 BTC) and liquidation mechanisms will need to be implemented.","errors":{"OwnableInvalidOwner(address)":[{"details":"The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)"}],"OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address)":[{"details":"The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation."}],"ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()":[{"details":"Unauthorized details","params":{"loanId":"The loan ID"},"returns":{"_0":"Loan struct"}},"getLoanIdByBorrower(address)":{"details":"Get loan ID by borrower address","params":{"borrower":"The borrower NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"requestLoan(uint256,string,string,bytes32,bytes32,uint32)":{"details":"Request a loan","params":{"amount":"The loan amount in ETH","btcAddress":"The Bitcoin address for escrow (p2TR so 62 chars or 63 max in regtest)","btcPubkey":"The borrower's Bitcoin Schnorr (x only) public key, 32 bytes","preimageHashBorrower":"hash of preimage chosen by borrower, when revealed lender uses to commit btc to collateral address","txid_p2tr0":"bitcoin transaction ID of the escrow UTXO","vout_p2tr0":"output index of the escrow UTXO in the bitcoin transaction"}},"setEtherSwapAddress(address)":{"details":"Set the EtherSwap contract address (only lender can call)","params":{"_etherSwapAddress":"The EtherSwap contract address this will lock in a specific etherswap version. updates will not be possible. Lender did not accept repayment.","params":{"loanId":"The loan ID"}}},"stateVariables":{"PROCESSING_FEE":{"details":"Contract parameters"},"_loanIds":{"details":"Loans \"Requested\" counter: This is total number of loans requested thus far, not the actual number outstanding or issued"},"borrowerToLoanId":{"details":"Mapping from borrower address to loan ID. acceptLoanOffer(uint256,bytes32).details: Accept loan offer by claiming from EtherSwap

params.preimageBorrower: The preimage (chosen by borrower) for accepting the loan offer.

acceptLoanRepayment(uint256,bytes32).details: Accept loan repayment by claiming from EtherSwap

params.preimageLender: The preimage (chosen by lender) for accepting the repayment.

associateLenderPreimageHash(uint256,byte.details: Associate lender's preimage hash with a pending loan request

params.loanId: The loan ID to associate preimage hash with
params.preimageHashLender: hash of preimage chosen by lender, when revealed borrower uses to claim BTC from collateral address

attemptRepayment(uint256,bytes32).details: Attempt loan repayment by locking funds in EtherSwap

deleteCompletedLoan(uint256).details: Delete a completed, defaulted, or abandoned loan request to free up storage

emergencyWithdraw().details: Emergency function to withdraw stuck ETH (only lender)

extendLoanOffer(uint256,bytes32,bytes32).details: Extend loan offer by locking funds in EtherSwap

params.preimageHashBorrower: hash of preimage chosen by borrower, when revealed lender uses to commit btc to collateral address
params.preimageHashLender: hash of preimage chosen by lender, when revealed borrower uses to claim BTC from collateral address

getLoanIdByBorrower(address).details: Get loan ID by borrower address

getTotalLoans().details: Get total number of loans ever requested. This is not the number of active loans.

markAsDefaulted(uint256).details: Mark loan as defaulted and withdraw lender's bond if loan is not repaid within timelockRepaymentAccept

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.btcAddress: The Bitcoin address for escrow (p2TR so 62 chars or 63 max in regtest)
params.btcPubkey: The borrower's Bitcoin Schnorr (x only) public key, 32 bytes
params.preimageHashBorrower: hash of preimage chosen by borrower, when revealed lender uses to commit btc to collateral address
params.txid_p2tr0: bitcoin transaction ID of the escrow UTXO
params.vout_p2tr0: output index of the escrow UTXO in the bitcoin transaction

setEtherSwapAddress(address).details: Set the EtherSwap contract address (only lender can call)

params._etherSwapAddress: The EtherSwap contract address this will lock in a specific etherswap version. updates will not be possible. Todo: production app should allow updates - but be careful about contract storage perhaps use proxy patterns

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.newBtcPubkey: New Bitcoin public key (64 char hex string)

updateParameters(uint256,uint256,uint256.details: Update contract parameters (only lender can call) should not impact active loans

withdrawRepaymentAttempt(uint256).details: Withdraw repayment attempt (refund from EtherSwap). Lender did not accept repayment.

ORIGIN_FEE_PERCENTAGE().notice: For info: Origin fee for activated loan, used on bitcoin side

requestLoan(uint256,string,string,bytes3.notice: txid_p2tr0 and vout_p2tr0 should be enough, we can drop "btcAddress": todo: drop btcAddress, it is not even stored in state, just event
